headline: 'What is he afraid of?': Congress ups the ante, targets PM Modi over Sebi chief row
paragraph: Congress has leveled corruption allegations against Sebi chief Madhabi Puri-Buch, claiming she rented her property to a company regularly dealing with Sebi. Congress leader Pawan Khera pointed out that Buch received substantial rent from Carol Info Services Limited, part of Wockhardt. The party also questioned Prime Minister Modi's inaction on the matter.

headline: 'Tie-up unlikely' as Congress, AAP talks hit deadlock in Haryana
paragraph: Congress and AAP's talks for a Haryana alliance have stalled due to disagreements over seat allocation. AAP, keen on the partnership, is preparing to contest 50 seats independently. Congress is hesitant to leave more than 3-4 seats for AAP, fearing potential advantages for BJP if the alliance doesn't work.

headline: 'In a democracy anyone can join politics': BJP on wrestlers' move
paragraph: BJP has minimized the significance of wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia joining Congress, asserting that anyone can participate in politics in a democracy. They highlighted that the case against former WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh is sub judice and stressed the need to keep sports and politics distinct.

headline: ED raids homes of ex-RG Kar principal, his kin and associates
paragraph: The Enforcement Directorate conducted searches at 11 locations, including the residence and farmhouse of former RG Kar Medical College principal Sandip Ghosh, over alleged financial irregularities. Prasun Chatterjee, a data entry operator at NMCH and close associate of Ghosh, was detained. Multiple residences linked to Ghosh's relatives and associates were also searched.

headline: I didn't find much support when I was abused: Raj Bhavan ex-staff
paragraph: Protests are ongoing in Kolkata and nationwide against the RG Kar doctor rape-murder case. A former Raj Bhavan staffer, who had accused Bengal governor C V Ananda Bose of sexual harassment, joined the protests. She emphasized her previous lack of support and expressed satisfaction that similar issues are now receiving more attention.

headline: Kolkata rape-murder case: CBI lawyer late for hearing by 50 mins
paragraph: A Kolkata court was delayed for 50 minutes by a CBI lawyer during a hearing on Sanjay Roy's bail application in the RG Kar hospital rape-murder case. The magistrate remanded Roy in judicial custody till September 20, as CBI opposed his bail plea and continues its investigation into the incident.

headline: Paris Paralympics, September 7: India's Full Schedule
paragraph: On the penultimate day of the Paris Paralympics, India's medal hopes remain focused on track and field athletes Simran, Navdeep, and Dilip Mahadu Gavit as they compete in their respective events. Additionally, para cyclists Arshad Shaik and Jyoti Gaderiya will also compete in their medal rounds.

headline: Kolkata governor sends anti-rape bill to Prez after day-long spat with TMC
paragraph: Bengal Governor C V Ananda Bose referred the Aparajita Woman and Child Bill to President Droupadi Murmu after criticizing the state government for insufficient preparation. The bill, which proposes severe penalties for rapists, was unanimously passed by the Bengal assembly but faced scrutiny over its originality and technical details.

headline: Ex-employee stole Rs 33 crore, reveals Swiggy’s annual report
paragraph: Swiggy reported in its annual financial statement that a former junior employee allegedly embezzled Rs 33 crore from one of its subsidiaries. The company has launched an investigation and filed a legal complaint.

headline: Gangster serving life term for murder ‘initiated into Juna Akhara as a monk’
paragraph: Prakash Pandey, an underworld don serving a life sentence, was initiated into monkhood in Almora jail and renamed 'Prakasha Nand Giri'. The ceremony by Juna Akhara seers raises questions about its approval. Jail officials deny involvement while an internal probe seeks to clarify the incident. Pandey's spiritual transformation continues to draw attention.

headline: Railways notices to wrestlers over political meets
paragraph: Railway sources revealed that Olympians Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia were served show cause notices after evidence showed them meeting political leaders with intentions of joining Congress. The wrestlers met Rahul Gandhi recently and resigned from their government positions, although their resignations have not been accepted yet.

headline: Panama deports 130 Indians who took 'donkey route'
paragraph: Panama deported 130 Indian migrants who entered through the Darien jungle, under a repatriation agreement with the US. This marks the first expulsion outside of the Americas under this deal. The US contributed $6 million to support these efforts, aiming to reduce irregular crossings at its southern border.

headline: Man selling street food in Chennai to American vlogger: If you Google my name, you’ll ...
paragraph: No paragraph available

headline: Three CRPF men among five killed by lightning in Chhattisgarh
paragraph: Over the past two days, five people have been killed by lightning strikes in Chhattisgarh, including three CRPF personnel. Two constables were struck during anti-insurgency training in Dantewada and another jawan died during an operation in Bijapur. Additionally, two civilians lost their lives in separate incidents in Jashpur district.

headline: Kolkata rape-murder case: Senior cop under attack for late FIR, vandalism at hospital removed
paragraph: Abhijit Mondal, officer-in-charge of Tala police station, has been replaced by Moloy Dutta following criticism over delays in registering an FIR for a rape and murder case at RG Kar hospital. Mondal, who cited health issues and is now hospitalized, faced scrutiny for his handling of the incident and subsequent vandalism at the hospital.

headline: Army intensifies training of Jammu civilians to fight terror
paragraph: In response to increased terrorism, the Army and J&K Police are training around 600 village defence guards in Jammu on using automatic rifles and tactical drills. This initiative aims to enhance local security ahead of the state assembly elections from Sept 18 to Oct 1, following earlier training sessions in Rajouri, Doda, and Kishtwar regions.

headline: British Sikhs warn against new definition of Islamophobia
paragraph: British Sikhs are challenging a new Islamophobia definition that they argue misrepresents history and curtails free speech. The Network of Sikh Organisations contends it hinders discussions about Sikh martyrs who resisted Mughal emperors. This contested definition, already adopted by the Labour party, may affect future race equality legislation and historical discourse.

headline: Salted ducks, Ferrari, cash: How China paid off NY official for 'spying'
paragraph: Linda Sun, a former aide to New York governors Andrew Cuomo and Kathy Hochul, is charged with acting as a secret agent for China. Prosecutors allege she used her political position to benefit Chinese interests, receiving millions in return. This case highlights growing concerns over China's influence operations within the US.

headline: AAP hints at solo contest in Haryana as alliance talks with Cong hit roadblock
paragraph: No paragraph available

headline: 4 Big reasons behind Nvidia's $279 bn loss in one day, biggest-ever for a US company
paragraph: Nvidia shares have seen a dramatic fall of 20% since June 18, including a record single-day drop of 9.5%. This decline is driven by increased regulatory scrutiny from U.S. and South Korean authorities, disappointing quarterly forecasts, and growing skepticism about the immediate benefits of the AI boom.

headline: 'Shaadi kar le bhai...': Ex-Pak cricketer's advice to Babar Azam
paragraph: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali has advised star batter Babar Azam to consider marriage as a way to improve his form and gain emotional stability. This suggestion comes after Babar's recent poor performances, including a disappointing showing in a Test series against Bangladesh. Fans and analysts are closely watching Babar's next moves.

headline: Will campaign against Phogat, Punia if BJP wants me to, says Brij Bhushan
paragraph: Former BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh stated he would campaign against wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia if they enter politics in Haryana. He maintained that their protest for his removal as WFI chief was a Congress conspiracy, blaming Haryana Congress leaders for attempting to tarnish his image.

headline: 'Any BJP candidate will defeat Phogat, Punia': Brij Bhushan on wrestlers joining Congress
paragraph: Ex-WFI chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, who faces sexual harassment allegations, stated that even a minor BJP candidate could defeat wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia in Haryana elections. He accused Congress of conspiring against him and claimed credit for popularizing wrestling in India.

headline: 'Made to sign blank paper ...': BJP accuses CM Mamata of Kolkata horror cover-up
paragraph: The BJP has raised concerns over the West Bengal government's response to a trainee doctor's rape and murder at RG Kar Medical College. Allegations involve bribery by a district collector and questionable police conduct. The BJP is demanding answers from Mamata Banerjee's administration regarding these serious accusations.

headline: Mid-air scare: Vistara flight diverted to Turkey after 'bomb on plane' message
paragraph: A Vistara Boeing 787 en route from Mumbai to Frankfurt was diverted to Erzurum airport in Turkey due to a bomb threat found on a tissue paper in the lavatory. The aircraft landed safely, and mandatory security checks are being conducted. Vistara is cooperating with authorities and prioritizing passenger safety.

headline: 'Biggest gift to country': PM Modi calls up Paralympic medallists
paragraph: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated India's newest Paris Paralympics medallists during a telephonic conversation, describing their victories as the 'biggest gift to the country'. With a total of 26 medals, including six golds, India has achieved its highest-ever medal tally at a Paralympics event. PM Modi also acknowledged the significant role played by the athletes' coaches.

headline: At least 12 killed in road accident in Hathras; Rs 2 lakh ex gratia announced
paragraph: A fatal collision on the Agra-Aligarh National Highway near Hathras claimed 12 lives and injured 16 others. The crash occurred during an overtaking attempt, according to Hathras District Magistrate Ashish Kumar. Efforts are underway to identify the victims, including four children, while authorities pledge accountability for those responsible.

headline: 2 held in Hyderabad whiskey-ice cream bust
paragraph: Excise officials in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills shut down an ice cream parlour for selling whiskey-infused ice cream. During a raid, they seized 11.5kg of the product and arrested two employees, with the owner still at large. Surprisingly, children were found to be the primary consumers of these alcoholic treats.

headline: Happy Ganesh Chaturthi 2024: Wishes, Messages, Quotes, Images, Facebook & WhatsApp status
paragraph: Ganesh Puja, also known as Ganesh Chaturthi, is a widely celebrated Indian festival marking Lord Ganesh's birthday. The festivities include decorating homes and public spaces, creating clay idols, and performing rituals with hymns and mantras. Public celebrations feature processions and cultural performances. The event concludes with the immersion of the idol in water.

headline: In rare verdict, Pakistan court orders removal of serving army general
paragraph: A Pakistani court has removed lieutenant general Munir Afsar from his position as chairman of Nadra, ruling that his appointment was unauthorised and violated existing rules. The decision came after a petition by Ashba Kamran, arguing that the appointment did not follow a fair and competitive process. This verdict challenges the military's influence in civil positions.
